 I understand what you're saying gman, but what appears to be, according to our earthly and very limited perspective isn't necessarily as it is in reality. Evo is based on what appears to be, in the physical World around us. The dating of the Earth based on either erosion or sedimentary build ups actually defy our ability to determine real age accurately, yet science proposes to do just that. The alleged changes that take place in life forms that is referred to as evo, dating fossils based on different dating systems, and accurately tracing one species that allegedly evolves into another is total speculation on the part of science.
 
 Unless we know what actually took place in the beginning and how it all came to be, specifically and precisely, then all of science pertaining to the physical World is one big assumption based on what we think happened and not based on what we know happened.
 
 Just think, we have a valid theory called the Young Earth Theory that dates everything at between 6000 and 25000 years old. And an Old Earth Theory that goes back 5.4 Billion Years by some estimates. And both sides insist they are right! You must admit that in this day of scientific and technological enlightenment, we are no further along in settling this debate than we were when Darwin wrote his first book. 
 
 Creation scientists read the sedimentary record of the placement of Strata as evidence of the Great Flood while evo scientists read the same evidence very differently, as evidence of an Old Earth. Obviously we can't both be right and most probably the truth lies somewhere in between what both sides believe. You must understand that I don't claim to have all the answers as this information is unknowable in my opinion, at least for now. But what I do know for certain is that evolution, abiogenisis, and the assumptions made by Geologists about the age of the Earth and biologists about macro-evolution is very wrong and unreliable. That much I do know and can not compromise on.

Define sin.

 
 One way to define it that you don't come across very often and there are are a few things about this that make you say ummmm
 
 Sin 
 (West Asian mythology)
 
 The moon god of Ur and first son of Enlil, the Sumerian god of earth and air. As 'lord of the calendar', his cult exhibited monotheistic tendencies, since it was Sin 'who determines the destinies of distant days' and whose 'plans no god knows'. According to Genesis, Abraham hailed from Ur by way of Harran, both cities devoted to the moon god. In Arabia, Sin was also worshipped under various titles and it is likely that Mount Sinai, first mentioned in Hebrew texts about 1000 BC, was connected with moon-worship.
 
 Other names for Sin were Suen and Nanna. Addressed in prayer as 'perfect in lordiness', Sin was associated with fertility, 'lord of the cowherders', the nether world, and kingship. A myth of Nanna's wooing of Ningal, the mother of goddess Inanna, relates how the god is repulsed until he has filled the rivers with the early flood, made the grain grow in the field, and caused fishes to be in the marshes, reeds along the banks of rivers, stags in the forest, plants in the desert, honey and wine in the orchards, cress in the garden, and long life in the palace. Only when all this bounty occurs is Ningal prepared to come and live with Nanna in his lofty dwelling on top of the ziggurat in Ur.

You have just confirmed what I have always thought was true. When asked why can't Christians accept anything different, my response would always be because it's all they have. Their lives would fall apart without that belief that there was someone who was there for them, who was looking out for them, who cared about them, who was proud of them and so on and so on. Without stating one way or the other about the existance of God, what do you suppose your life would be like without God? So of course anything that may try to take that away from you you going to fight, just as you are, even against overwhelming evidence, just as you are. 
 
 If we truly understood the foundation upon which all scientific assumptions and presumptions are made, then I would have more faith in it. But I understand all too well how limited and flawed your human perspective is. I understand that mans need to answer unknowable questions while ignoring our spiritual roots makes evo the only reasonable avenue for answers. But that doesn't make those answers the right ones. And NO, nothing can shake my belief structure at all.
 
 Again apply your statement to religion and then compare to science. And again you prove my point. As long as you are unwilling accept the truth (not saying that that truth is there is no God) then your stuck. I think the smart religious people are the ones who are out there bring religion and science together or approach their religion from a scientific point of view. They listened to thier mother when she said because is not an answer.
 
 True enough. Accepting valid science does not mean rejecting God at all. Not in any way. If science answered these questions for us with actual supportable documentable evidence that didn't change every month, then i would gladly embrace them with great enthusiasm and joy. But i wont accept or believe a lie just to please men of little or no faith. 
 
 But you will for men of faith. Funny how the evidence you will accept for your position is word of mouth, circumstantial, because we always do it that way, but there isn't any evidence possible that you will accept that is contrary to what you think is real. 
 
 The only cold hard reality anyone will eventually find out around here is when you learn that God can do anything He wills to be accomplished. And that he is the God of all that is. I truly hope for your sake that by then, He has gotten you where you need to be. emoticon_xangel

 
 You could have at least tried to answer the question, but we already know why you didn't.

archangel is right in calling himself an unworthy servant. For he has given religion a bad name.
 
 and why does he calls himself an archangel? Did jesus appointed him one?
 
 Archangel is one of those persons so afraid of dying that he clutches to his beliefs like a drowning man to a lifesaver. Pathetic really.

archangel is right in calling himself an unworthy servant. For he has given religion a bad name.

 
 What have I said that offended you Winston ? Is the truth so offensive to you ?
 
 
and why does he calls himself an archangel? Did jesus appointed him one?

 
 Archangel is an internet handle winston, it isn't my real name. I thought that was obvious. My real name is ALI dontya know :) . Now, Angels are a created species of supernatural beings created to serve God and Man. They are servants with no free will so being human, I mortal to their immortal. But thanks for thinking I'm more than human, but I'm not.
 
 
Archangel is one of those persons so afraid of dying that he clutches to his beliefs like a drowning man to a lifesaver. Pathetic really.

 
 Now why would you interpret my confidence in Christ as clutching to beliefs like a drowning man winston ? Do I really come off as afraid of life or anything to you ? Are my values motivated by fear or do I freely and openly share what God has done for me ? Wouldn't one who is acting from fear also be afraid to share his beliefs for fear of them being disproved ? But as I've said, no man can disprove the personal experiences I have had with my Heavenly Father and Savior. His Holy Spirit dwells within me and i am His as He is mine. We are one winston. Read my siggy again as it says it best and very concisely.

Is the truth so offensive to you ?

 
 How is it that the religious have the truth but no facts?

How is it that the religious have the truth but no facts?

 
 Or that science has plenty of fact but no truth?

[QUOTE=Archangel;265363] Is the truth so offensive to you ?
 
 
 
 
 
 Gaetano:
 The truth is not offensive, but what is offensive is your bold assumption that you know what it is. Your "truth" is a belief, and while that belief may be your reality it is not your place to insist that it is a reality for others as well. It is a complete and utter lack of respect for your fellow human beings who happen to hold beliefs that are different from yours. As beauty is in the eye of the beholder, so truth is in the mind of those who believe they have found it. When you become secure with your belief, the need to denounce and/or belittle the beliefs of others should subside.

[QUOTE=peteratwar;265643]

 
 Very fair remarks BUT having seen many threads I don't think they apply only to Archangel. There are many more on this forum to whom they could also apply.

 
 Perhaps, but many of their 'truths' are based upon testable evidence and not reliant upon what amounts to "I say so, disagree and you'll pay" arguments that Arch building everything he says on. Show these people evidence that proves their beliefs to be wrong and you'll see them change. Furthermore, they don't around saying their beliefs are the absolute truth. There's a considerable difference there that must be acknowledged.

Beliefs especially religious beliefs or atheistic beliefs etc aren't by their nature testable. Each has their vigorous adherents 'I'm right and you are wrong'.
 
 Even scientific debate has different interpretations generating equally entrenched ideas.
 
 Bu I agree it is nice when you see the occasional gem of acceptance.

Beliefs especially religious beliefs or atheistic beliefs etc aren't by their nature testable. Each has their vigorous adherents 'I'm right and you are wrong'.

 
 It's just a pity that these people can't see that they haven't moved past the 3rd grade "I'm right because I say so!"
 
 
Even scientific debate has different interpretations generating equally entrenched ideas.

 
 True, but these are based upon differing outcomes of a set of peer reviewed experiments. Actual data, procedure etc is used. That does not exist with the religious "agree or burn" attitude. If scientists disagree, they go back to the lab and run tests, not threaten eternal damnation as Arch has done repeatively.

You know when it comes right down to it everything is faith.
 
 We all could be trapped away from reality in some Cartesian way.
 
 Science, the popular media, Satan or whoever could be manipulating us into believing things that are not true.
 
 Information could be in accurate or not fully understood and when it comes right down to it none of us really really know the truth. 
 
 I guess the difference is that if I have to buy a car I would rather buy it from a guy who is not wearing a plaid suit.

You know when it comes right down to it everything is faith.

 
 Depends what you mean by faith.
 
 Faith that some eye in the sky is watching out for you and if you do his little dance you go to Heaven or Faith that the sun will rise tomorrow and that my extremely reliable coworker will get that damn report done in time for the 8 am meeting on thursday? Which faith are you talking about? 
 
 
Science, the popular media, Satan or whoever could be manipulating us into believing things that are not true.

 
 Has the thought ever crossed your mind that we could be in fact worshiping Satan? That the greatest deceiver managed to trick everyone into believing they were worshiping God when they actually worship him and our moral system is completely opposite of what God actually wants? Creepy thought isn't it?

I'm right because God says so. And my relationship with Him may not be provable to you, but it has been confirmed for me and within me too many times to count. God is not a scientific experiment that can be proven in a lab, and neither will He perform for the vanity of faithless people who insist that unless He puts on a show for them, they are too smart to believe in him. But neither will He be mocked. Of this you can be sure.

 BAM Didn't need to change a single word to turn it right at you.

It seems a number of Christians believe also in evolution.
 
 To those of you out there who believe in both I'd like to know a few things...
 
 a) Did we evolve a soul?
 
 b) Why did Jesus come to save us? (when did the first sin happen?)

 
 Well, I'm a Christian who believes that evolution is a fact.
 
 a) my personal view is that all sentient beings have souls, and that souls are intricately linked with mental awareness/cognisance (Dolphins, monkeys, apes, octopuses, parrots, etc.). So, I'd say yes we evolved it (I think god "attaches" it to us when our minds develop), and it occured with the dawn of sentience.
 
 b) The "first sin" is something that has always existed ever since death existed. I don't view it as a particular event (Adam and Eve myth is a sort of metaphor or way of talking about it). Jesus came to take that sin away, allowing us to overcome death in eternity.

Good questions. Questions that evolution believing christians can never answer using the bible. Which means that in order to accept evo, one can not also claim to be a christian as the two belief systems don't now mesh nor will they ever.

 
 What about God creating evolution?
How do literal creationists reconcile their lives with reality? After all, if their beliefs were indeed true, this wouldn't wouldn't exist as we see it today.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  How do Christians reconcile themselves with evolution?
